lv.emes.libraries.tools

Class MS_KeyCodeDictionary

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.tools.MS_KeyCodeDictionary

  • public class MS_KeyCodeDictionary
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds mapping for system keystroke codes to be translated from String to int type.

    Methods: -textToKeyCode -needToPushShiftToWriteChar

    Version:
    0.9.
    Author:
    eMeS

      static boolean needToPushShiftToWriteChar(char aChar)
      Tests whether char can be written on keyboard only with pressed Shift key.
      static int textToKeyCode(java.lang.String text)
      Returns key code of input text.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MS_KeyCodeDictionary

        public MS_KeyCodeDictionary()

    • Method Detail

      • textToKeyCode

        public static int textToKeyCode(java.lang.String text)
        Returns key code of input text. Every recognizable keys are tested in MSKeyCodeDictionaryTest.
        import static lv.emes.libraries.tools.MS_KeyCodeDictionary.textToKeyCode;
        Parameters:
        text - a code that can be recognized by this dictionary. For example "CTRL" for button Control key code.
        Returns:
        corresponding key code.

      • needToPushShiftToWriteChar

        public static boolean needToPushShiftToWriteChar(char aChar)
        Tests whether char can be written on keyboard only with pressed Shift key.
        Parameters:
        aChar - character to be written using keyboard.
        Returns:
        true if written using combination Shift + aChar. Also returns true if char is capital letter.
